commText: Welcome back for the chase. Despite Jaiswal being on strike, RCB are going to start with left-arm spin. The two deep fielders are on the leg-side - long-on and square leg. Here we go

Ashwin: It's been a tournament of two halves for me. First half into the tournament I was struggling coming from the Test series with injuries. Last few games I feel I am bowling really well. I texted Virat saying come on let's fight it one more time (smiles). Dew has come on nicely. The IPL committee has done well overall in the tournament to manage the dew. (On RR's recent poor batting efforts) Got to reset button. Also got to look at the pitches we played on in those games. Not hiding behind the fact that we didn't bat well in the last few games but it's just about hitting the reset button, go out and enjoy in the middle. (On the total) I think it's par-minus.

Highest scores without an individual 50-plus score in IPL playoffs 182/8 - MI vs LSG, Chennai, 2023 Eliminator 178/6 - SRH vs CSK, Mumbai, 2018 Final 174/7 - SRH vs KKR, Kolkata, 2018 Qualifier 2 172/8 - RCB vs RR, Ahmedabad, 2024 Eliminator 171/5 - CSK vs GT, Ahmedabad, 2023 Final Most economical spell by a seamer in IPL 2024 (min. 3 overs) 3 - Bhuvneshwar Kumar (2/12 off 4) vs LSG, Hyderabad 3.5 - Jasprit Bumrah (3/14 off 4) vs GT, Ahmedabad 3.5 - Mayank Yadav (3/14 off 4) vs RCB, Bengaluru 3.91 - Naveen-ul-Haq (1/15 off 3.5) vs MI, Lucknow 4 - Trent Boult (1/16 off 4) vs RCB, Ahmedabad RR bowling today Boult & Ashwin: 3/35 in 8 overs (ER: 4.375) Sandeep, Avesh & Chahal: 5/135 in 12 overs (ER: 11.25) Most catches in an innings for RR (non-wicketkeepers) 4 - Riyan Parag vs RCB, Pune, 2022 4 - Rovman Powell vs RCB, Ahmedabad, 2024 Rovman Powell became the first fielder to bag four catches in an IPL playoffs game.

Most wickets in IPL playoffs 28 - Dwayne Bravo 21 - Ravichandran Ashwin 20 - Mohit Sharma 19 - Ravindra Jadeja 17 - Harbhajan Singh Most runs in an IPL season 973 - Virat Kohli (RCB, 2016) 890 - Shubman Gill (GT, 2023) 863 - Jos Buttler (RR, 2022) 848 - David Warner (SRH, 2016) 741 - Virat Kohli (RCB, 2024)

21:18 Local Time, 15:48 GMT, 21:18 IST: RR will be quite satisfied with their bowling effort. They've done well to restrict RCB to 172, and should fancy their chances with dew around. A couple of really standout performances with the ball for them, starting with Trent Boult who set the tone with the new ball. He bowled three overs in the powerplay and gave just six runs, including the wicket of Faf du Plessis. There was no width given for the openers, and no freebies on the fuller length either. Having kept the rate in check during the powerplay, RR then turned to their spinners and Ashwin responded beautifully with a brilliant spell where he gave nothing away. The pressure that he built eventually resulted in a couple of wickets in his final over, and with figures of 2/19, he just didn't allow RCB to get away. They weren't able to get away in the death either as Avesh Khan came to the party. He had gone for 30 in his first two overs but finished superbly as the Royals gave away just 47 in the last five overs, denying the final flourish that RCB needed desperately. It's over to their batters now to get the job done.

Sandeep Sharma to Karn Sharma, out Caught by Powell!! Another catch for Powell in the deep as Karn holes out off the final ball! Low full toss outside off, Karn goes after it and slices it in the air to sweeper cover. Easily taken. Karn Sharma c Powell b Sandeep Sharma 5(4) [4s-1]
Sandeep Sharma to Karn Sharma, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Sandeep Sharma to Swapnil Singh, 1 run, again very wide outside off, Swapnil almost runs at the ball looking to swing it over square leg. But he toe-ends it into the cover region
Sandeep Sharma to Swapnil Singh, SIX, oh Swapnil has picked the bones out of this! Full toss outside off, he walks across the stumps, gets in position and slogs it a long way over square leg
Sandeep Sharma to Karn Sharma, 1 run, length ball outside off, Karn swings hard and slices it in the air. It falls in front of sweeper cover

Sandeep Sharma to Karn Sharma, FOUR, misfield and four! Slower short ball outside off, Karn cuts to backward point where Jaiswal misses it completely. He got foxed by the little turn there, but that's no excuse
Sandeep Sharma to Swapnil Singh, 1 run, slower length ball wide of off, Swapnil looks to slog but toe-ends it to long-on
Sandeep Sharma [3.0-0-35-0] is back into the attack
Avesh Khan to Karn Sharma, no run, another wide yorker outside off, Karn swings and misses. What an over! Just five off it along with a couple of wickets
Karn Sharma, left handed bat, comes to the crease

Avesh Khan to Lomror, out Caught by Powell!! Third wicket for Avesh who has bounced back superbly after getting hit for 30 off his first two overs. It's a wide yorker outside off, Lomror tries to carve it away but can only slice it in the air as far as deep point. Compared to the catch he took to dismiss Faf earlier, this is a dolly for Powell. Lomror c Powell b Avesh Khan 32(17) [4s-2 6s-2]
Avesh Khan to Lomror, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Avesh Khan to Lomror, FOUR, full and wide outside off, Lomror throws his bat at it and it goes flying off a thick edge over short third
Avesh Khan to Swapnil Singh, 1 run, banged in short on off, 121kph, and Swapnil mistimes the pull through midwicket
Swapnil Singh, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Swapnil Singh comes in as the impact sub.

Avesh Khan to Karthik, out Caught by Jaiswal!! Sliced in the air, and taken! Karthik just couldn't get going today, and he's gone for 11 off 13 balls. Short ball outside off, takes Karthik by surprise and gets big on him as he looks to slap it away. He ends up slicing it over extra cover where Jaiswal jogs back and takes it safely. Karthik c Jaiswal b Avesh Khan 11(13) [4s-1]
Avesh Khan to Karthik, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Avesh Khan to Karthik, no run, Karthik goes for a premeditated scoop but is outfoxed by Avesh who saw him move. He bowls a slower ball very wide outside off, Karthik tries to improvise with a reverse-scoop but is beaten
Avesh Khan [3.0-0-39-1] is back into the attack

Boult to Karthik, 1 run, full at the stumps, it's in the slot but Karthik fails to get hold of it. He looks to go big down the ground but mistimes it to long-on. A superb spell from Boult comes to an end as he finishes with 1/16
Third and fine leg are in the ring as Boult comes from round the wicket
Boult to Lomror, 1 run, full and wide, 139.3kph, Lomror throws his bat at it and carves it to sweeper cover
Boult to Lomror, 2 runs, goes for the yorker again but Lomror is able to whip this one through midwicket. He's found the gap and gets back for two
Boult to Lomror, no run, yorker on off, Lomror can't do much other than squeeze it back to Boult

Boult to Lomror, FOUR, slower ball wide of off, short of length, and Lomror puts it away! He reaches out and slaps it over extra cover. While DK hasn't quite got going at the other end, Lomror is playing a good knock
Boult to Lomror, 2 runs, full toss on off, Lomror swipes it through midwicket without getting much timing, back for two
Trent Boult [3.0-0-6-1] is back into the attack
By the way, there has been dew on the outfield since a few overs now.
Sandeep Sharma to Lomror, 1 run, length ball wide of off, 116.1kph, and Lomror flat-bats it to long-off
Sandeep Sharma to Lomror, 2 runs, full ball just outside off, Lomror walks across and flicks it wide of long-on. Easy couple of runs
Sandeep Sharma to Karthik, 1 run, yorker on leg stump, Karthik backs away and squeezes it out
Sandeep Sharma to Lomror, 1 run, back of a length outside off, slower one, and it's slapped to sweeper cover
Sandeep Sharma to Karthik, 1 run, slower bouncer around the head, Karthik pulls very gently into the on-side for a single. Sandeep gives chase himself
Sandeep Sharma to Karthik, FOUR, very loose ball from Sandeep, and it's punished! Low full toss well down the leg-side, Karthik goes for the sweep and whacks it past short fine
Sandeep Sharma [2.0-0-25-0] is back into the attack

More on that LBW being overturned: To the naked eye it seemed liked there was a deviation of the bat. UltraEdge showed a small spike first when DK's bat hit the pad before the ball came. And then there was a massive spike, which the third ump interpreted as ball hitting bat. There seemed to be a gap between bat and ball at one point and usually such spikes appear when ball hits the pad or body and the ones on the bat are smaller. Sangakkara and RR were totally convinced it wasn't bat on ball. Sanga even moved from his dugout and summoned the reserve umpire. Probably the third ump not taking enough looks at it fuelled that move from Sanga.
Timeout! This innings continues to swing back and forth. There will be a couple of wickets, and then a burst of runs. These last four overs going to be very crucial.

Lowest average for a player batting in top 6 in an IPL season 5.42 - Devdutt Padikkal (LSG, 2024) 5.77 - Glenn Maxwell (RCB, 2024) 7.44 - Deepak Hooda (LSG, 2023) 7.72 - Nicholas Pooran (PBKS, 2021) 8.66 - Dwayne Bravo (MI, 2010) *minimum seven innings

Chahal to Lomror, SIX, second time Lomror has taken on the bigger side against Chahal, and he gets six more! Tossed up outside off, he reaches out, swings hard and launches it over wide long-on. Despite just two runs off his first over, Chahal finishes on the expensive side again as he returns with 1/43
Chahal to Karthik, 1 run, 91.4kph, slightly quicker on off, Karthik gets on one knee and sweeps to deep midwicket
Chahal to Lomror, 1 run, tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
Chahal to Karthik, 1 run, sliding into the pads, clipped behind square
This is a good matchup for RR - Chahal to Karthik
Chahal to Karthik, no run, tossed up on off, Karthik backs away initially before getting back into his stance and knocks it to cover
Most sixes in the middle-overs (7-15) in an IPL season 30 - Chris Gayle (RCB, 2012) 30 - Rajat Patidar (RCB, 2024) 28 - Glenn Maxwell (PBKS, 2014) 24 - Shivam Dube (CSK, 2023)
Chahal to Karthik, no run, 87.9kph full ball on off, Karthik gets forward and pushes it back to Chahal
Avesh Khan to Karthik, 1 run, full delivery on off, Karthik knocks it to long-on
Avesh Khan to Lomror, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Lomror looks to cut and chops it wide of point
Avesh Khan to Karthik, 1 run, fuller than a length just outside off, goes off the outside half through point

Avesh Khan to Karthik, no run, Avesh has turned his evening around in a matter of two balls! This is a superb delivery to trap DK LBW. Oh wait, he's gone for the review. Is there an inside edge involved? Full and straight, bending in late, and he plays across the line of it before getting smashed on the pad. Now there's a big spike on UltraEdge, but it's hard to figure out if that's off bat hitting pad or the inside edge. However, the ball is very close to the inside edge and there may be a deviation as well. Third umpire is satisfied that there's bat involved. Don't think Sangakkara is convinced. He immediately gets up from the dugout and goes over to the fourth umpire
Dinesh Karthik, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Review

Most ducks in an IPL season 5 - Jos Buttler (RR, 2023) 4 - Herschelle Gibbs (Deccan Chargers, 2009) 4 - Mithun Manhas (PWI, 2011) 4 - Manish Pandey (PWI, 2012) 4 - Shikhar Dhawan (DC, 2020) 4 - Eoin Morgan (KKR, 2021) 4 - Nicholas Pooran (PBKS, 2021) 4 - Dinesh Karthik (RCB, 2023) 4 - Glenn Maxwell (RCB, 2024)

Avesh Khan to Rajat Patidar, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Avesh strikes back! He has been taken for a lot of runs so far, and doesn't offer much in terms of celebrations. But this is a massive wicket of the in-form Patidar. Another slower one dug into the pitch, but the line is outside off this time. Patidar looks to flat-bat it over the mid-off fielder who's inside the ring, doesn't get hold of it, and Parag takes a fine catch pedalling back. Rajat Patidar c Riyan Parag b Avesh Khan 34(22) [4s-2 6s-2]
Avesh Khan to Rajat Patidar, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Avesh Khan to Rajat Patidar, SIX, awful delivery from Avesh, and it disappears. Slower short ball down the leg-side, Patidar swivels across, pulls hard and it goes sailing over the fine leg boundary
Avesh Khan [2.0-0-30-0] is back into the attack
Chahal to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, very full on middle and leg, Patidar squeezes it through midwicket

Chahal to Rajat Patidar, FOUR, much needed boost for RCB after two wickets in the previous over. Both these batters have gone after Chahal with good success. Floated up wide of off, length ball, Patidar goes after it and absolutely slaps it through cover. Even Chahal is impressed with that shot
Chahal to Lomror, 1 run, quite full at the stumps, Lomror knocks it to long-on

Chahal to Lomror, SIX, slog-sweep from Lomror to the long side of the ground. Oh it's a difficult chance for Jaiswal in the deep and he tips it over the ropes. He was running to his left, and his momentum would've taken him over the boundary anyway. Chahal not happy with that effort
Chahal to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, fired in full at the toes, Patidar swipes across the line again and lofts it towards deep midwicket. It goes on the bounce to the fielder

Most ducks in the IPL 18 - Dinesh Karthik 18 - Glenn Maxwell 17 - Rohit Sharma 16 - Piyush Chawla 16 - Sunil Narine Most ducks in Men’s T20 cricket 44 - Sunil Narine 43 - Alex Hales 42 - Rashid Khan 32 - Glenn Maxwell 32 - Paul Stirling

Chahal to Rajat Patidar, SIX, 90kph, drifting in on leg, and Patidar sends it sailing over the midwicket boundary. Was the short side of the ground there. He bends his back knee to get under it, and nails the slog
Yuzvendra Chahal [2.0-0-15-1] is back into the attack
Four overs for 19 runs and 2 wickets with hardly any help from the pitch for spinners. That is some spell from Ravi Ashwin

Summary (Overs 7-13) -- 47/3, 6.7rpo -- Chahal gets rid of Kohli for 33 (7.2) -- Green gets off to a brisk start -- Patidar dropped on 5 by Jurel (10.4) -- Green dismissed by Ashwin for 27 (12.3) -- Maxwell holes out first ball off Ashwin (12.4) -- Ashwin finishes with 2/19
Ashwin to Lomror, no run, flatter delivery on the stumps, Lomror defends
Green vs Ashwin in the IPL Runs: 20 Balls: 20 Dismissals: 2
Ashwin to Lomror, no run, round the wicket, Lomror covers the line and defends
Mahipal Lomror, left handed bat, comes to the crease

Ashwin to Maxwell, out Caught by Dhruv Jurel!! In the airrrr and straight to long-on. What have you done Maxi? Ashwin in absolute joy while Virat is fuming at the batter under his disguised calm look sitting in the dug out. This was school level cricket from Maxi trying to take on a bowler when he had only 3 balls left. This game has turned on his head. Fullish carrom ball from Ashwin, dangled the carrot again. Maxwell fell in the trap and slogged, only to slice it straight to long-on. Maxwell c Dhruv Jurel b Ashwin 0(1)
Ashwin to Maxwell, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Glenn Maxwell, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Maxwell v Ashwin now. This is going to be spicy!

Ashwin to Green, out Caught by Powell!! It's Rovman Powell again with another great catch. This time he had to run back from extra-cover and take that off balance. When he had to fall on the back was a pretty solid impact on the ground and glad he's alright. Made it look simple with the reverse cup falling back. Ashwin gets his reward finally for a brilliant bowling spell and he's got Green the aggressor. The carrom ball into the wicket, Green backed away to loft, toe-ended it high and that's another fielder's wicket. Green c Powell b Ashwin 27(21) [4s-2 6s-1]
Ashwin to Green, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Ashwin to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, backs away and looks to slog, toe-ends it to deep mid-wicket
Ashwin to Green, 1 run, Green steps out. Ashwin drops it short and forces a gentle punch to long-off
Pretty good over from Avesh Khan although the scoreboard won't say that. Nailed his yorkers pretty well

Avesh Khan to Green, 1 run, lovely yorker again, dug out to extra-cover. Rajat Patidar took for a run but sent back as it wasn't on. Fielder has a shy at the bowler's end and misses. They get the run eventually now
Avesh Khan to Green, FOUR, he misses the yorker and that's what Green needed. Thumps this down the ground over the ump's head and smacks it for four
Avesh Khan to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, lovely yorker outside off stump, Patidar squeezes it to deep backward point
Now backward point pushed to the boundary so it's going to be the wide yorkers from Avesh Khan

Avesh Khan to Rajat Patidar, FOUR, brilliant from Patidar. Nothing wrong with the ball. The perfect wide yorker with third man and backward point in. Patidar managed to squeeze this to the right of backward point and sweeper had no chance
Avesh Khan to Rajat Patidar, 2 runs, a one-handed slice past backward point as Avesh Khan bowls the low full toss trying the wide yorker
Avesh Khan to Green, 1 run, low full toss, Green drills it to long-on
Avesh Khan [1.0-0-17-0] is back into the attack
Ashwin to Green, 1 run, fullish delivery, Green drives to long-on
Ashwin to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, pushed to cover

Ashwin to Rajat Patidar, 2 runs, in the airrrrr, dropped. That was a sitter for Dhruv Jurel. Shortish delivery, Patidar looks to pull, sliced this high and straighter towards long-on. Jurel ran in and got to the circle, had everything covered but wasn't looking at the ball close enough and it popped out. Ashwin wears a helpless look
Patidar is a good hitter of spin but he's up against Ashwin who is unwilling to offer slot balls. Pressure mounting!
Ashwin to Rajat Patidar, no run, oh almost through him! He's flicked that with a finger and made it swing back into the right-hander, Patidar was surprised and got an inside edge on his defence
Ashwin to Rajat Patidar, wide, fired down leg
Ashwin to Rajat Patidar, no run, flatter delivery on the stumps, Patidar defends it back to the bowler
Ashwin to Green, 1 run, shortish delivery, Green punches it along the ground to long-off
This over has slightly increased the tempo for RCB but they are in a tricky situation. Can't afford to lose wickets trying to up the ante
Most wickets for RR in the IPL 66 - Yuzvendra Chahal (SR: 15.6) 65 - Siddharth Trivedi (SR: 23.1) 61 - Shane Watson (SR: 22.3) 57 - Shane Warne (SR: 20.9) 47 - James Faulkner (SR: 19.2)
Chahal to Green, 1 run, Green went real hard this full delivery, dragged off the inside edge wide of long-on
Chahal to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, mishit but doesn't carry! Patidar slogged on the rise, luckily didn't hit it well enough to carry to deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Rajat Patidar, no run, oh he's yorked him with a flighted delivery, Patidar drives and Chahal dives to the right to stop the ball
Chahal to Green, 1 run, back to being brave again! Floaty full delivery slightly outside off stump, Green drives to long-off

Chahal to Green, FOUR, and he's forced Chahal to hide the ball on the off-side! That is a mini battle won. Fast and short to stop the batter from getting under the ball but he's offered so much width that Green slaps it hard off the back foot through extra-cover
Chahal to Green, SIX, he's nailed that! Full and in the slot, Green slightly clears the front leg out of the way and muscles the slog over mid-wicket for a mighty six
Ashwin to Rajat Patidar, 2 runs, nudged to mid-wicket and quickly comes back for the second

Ashwin to Rajat Patidar, no run, oh play and miss! Ashwin offered a fullish ball slightly leg-side, but it could be a trap because he does that usually for a catch at deep backward square leg. Patidar went for the slog-sweep and missed to get hit on the thigh pad. No problem for LBW because it wasn't straight
Ashwin to Green, 1 run, flatter and on the leg stump, Green pushes it to long-on
Ashwin to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, flatter delivery, Patidar nudges to long-on
Virat Kohli in IPL playoffs Inns: 15 Runs: 341 Avg: 26.23 SR: 122.66 50s: 2 HS: 70*
Ashwin to Rajat Patidar, no run, leg-side ball, Patidar tries to tickle it fine but picks out short fine leg
Ashwin to Green, 1 run, full delivery, Green drives along the ground to long-off
Chahal to Green, 1 run, pushed along the ground to long-off
Chahal to Green, no run, fullish from Chahal, Green blocks
Chahal to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, slightly leg-sidish, Patidar works it to deep square leg
Chahal to Rajat Patidar, no run, covers the line and defends
Rajat Patidar, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Chahal to Kohli, out Caught by (sub)Donovan Ferreira!! In the airrrrr and taken! Chahal's dangled the carrot and got the big wicket. Slot ball leggie inviting the big hit and Virat has not been shy of the slog-sweep this season. Didn't time it as well and it's straight to deep mid-wicket who was really close to the rope. Chahal starts well against his former team. Virat knew he got that it on the inside half of the bat and looked at that ball travel to the deep knowing he was in trouble. That ball didn't turn and went straight, which is what foxed Virat. Kohli c (sub)Donovan Ferreira b Chahal 33(24) [4s-3 6s-1]
Chahal to Kohli, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Chahal to Kohli, no run, oh Virat wanted to drive through cover but hit it back to Chahal as the ball took the inside half of the bat
Yuzvendra Chahal, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack
Best ER in the Powerplay in IPL 2024 8.26 - RR 8.77 - CSK 9.04 - PBKS 9.2 - MI 9.36 - SRH

Timeout. So all the odd overs have been really tight while the even overs have gone for runs. Boult was so stingy and went for just 6 runs and got the big wicket of Faf, but Sandeep and Avesh have been expensive. Ashwin has showed great control to keep the rate in check. But Virat.. How well has he been batting. The intent, the placement, the timing.. everything so good. This looks like a 200 wicket. Lot of work to do
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, flatter carrom ball, Virat flicks to mid-wicket

Trent Boult in the Powerplay in IPL 2024 Overs: 35 Wickets: 9 Avg: 26.11 SR: 23.33 ER: 6.71 Dots: 110 (52.38%) He’s the joint-second highest wicket-taker in the powerplay this season alongside Mitchell Starc, only behind Bhuvneshwar Kumar (10).
Ashwin to Green, 1 run, oh almost yorked him there. Green advanced and just managed to dig it out to long-off
Ashwin to Green, wide, this time it's a wide because the line was further down leg than the previous ball and Green wins this leave
Ashwin to Green, no run, Green leaves thinking it will be a wide but it's a smart carrom ball from Ashwin that runs towards the batter and hits the pad to win a dot

Most wickets in the Powerplay in the IPL 71 - Bhuvneshwar Kumar 59 - Trent Boult 59 - Sandeep Sharma 58 - Deepak Chahar 58 - Umesh Yadav Boult has taken 50 wickets in the powerplay in the IPL since 2020, well clear of the next best Mohammed Shami (39).
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, carrom ball following Virat as he goes leg-side, pushed to long-off sans balance
Ashwin to Green, 1 run, full and straight, Green drives to long-on
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, flatter delivery, Virat works it to mid-wicket
Ravichandran Ashwin, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
STAT: Kohli becomes the first to 8,000 IPL runs, the next highest aggregate in the competition is Shikhar Dhawan's 6769.
Not a bad powerplay for RCB but RR will be happy with that wicket too. Interestingly Green has been promoted. But he was actually doing a fine job down the order

Powerplay summary -- Boult keeps it tight, others bowlers suffer -- Kohli continues to look in good touch -- Avesh goes for 17 in his first over -- Faf is dismissed for 17 by Boult (4.4) -- Green burns a review for a wide (4.5) -- Sandeep goes for 25 in two overs
Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, 1 run, short slower delivery, Virat gently pulls through mid-wicket

Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, FOUR, what a wonderful shot that is from Virat. He stepped out, Sandeep tried to cramp him with a full delivery, but he used his feet so well to give some room and flick it wide of mid-on for four
Sandeep Sharma to Green, 1 run, Green makes extra room as he looks to drive inside out with Sandeep cramping him for room, driven uppishly to mid-off
Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, 1 run, exposes his stumps and then pushes this length delivery to mid-off
Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, 2 runs, slower delivery, Virat nudges it through backward square leg and gets two
Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, FOUR, RCB have no choice but to take runs from the other end and Virat takes Sandeep Sharma down over mid-off for a boundary early in the over. Slot ball and easily put away
Sandeep Sharma [1.0-0-12-0] is back into the attack
Boult to Green, no run, short of length delivery, Green defends. Boult has given just 6 runs in 3 overs now
Boult to Green, no run, good length delivery angling across, Green lets it go and thinks it's a wide. Goes for the review and that's an absolute waste from RCB, inside the line says the ump
Cameron Green, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Boult to du Plessis, out Caught by Powell!! Oh a screamer from Rovman! He flew full length forward to complete this stunning catch and it looks clean. "Fingers are under the ball. He has taken it fairly," says third ump and RR get their first. Needed some help from the fielders with these two going great and Rovman led from the front. Was a shortish delivery, Faf pulled and didn't connect really well. RR had two fielders in the deep on the on-side. Deep mid-wicket had to run in and then dive forward to complete that catch and he certainly has lifted his team with that effort. du Plessis c Powell b Boult 17(14) [4s-2 6s-1]
Boult to du Plessis, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Boult to Kohli, leg byes, 1 run, swings and misses! Shortish delivery, Virat misses the pull and gets hit on the thigh pad, ball rolls to allow a single
Boult to Kohli, no run, oh full toss! Virat backed away to go big, but he sliced this hit straight to cover-point. Was an attempted yorker that went as a full toss
Boult to Kohli, 2 runs, calming nudge through mid-wicket along the ground and it's two more
Great start for RCB. Problems already for RR. Runs are leaking from one end and they only have five proper bowlers. Parag can roll his arm over of course but this venue doesn't offer much for spin

Avesh Khan to du Plessis, FOUR, slog, dragged wide of mid-on and it's four more! Length delivery, may have been pace off because Faf was slightly early into the shot and it went off the inner half of the bat between mid-on and mid-off
Avesh Khan to Kohli, 1 run, length delivery outside off stump, nicely opens the bat face and guides it to deep backward point
Avesh Khan to du Plessis, 1 run, steered down to short third man
Avesh Khan to du Plessis, FOUR, cheeky from Faf. Moved well across the stumps before the bowler delivered and got into position to scoop, ball takes the edge and escapes fine to the fine leg boundary
Avesh Khan to Kohli, 1 run, sane short of length delivery outside off stump, Virat pushes to point for a single

Avesh Khan to Kohli, SIX, short with fine leg in the ring is a gift and Virat in this form is not going to miss out. He asks if that is one bumper for the over. Got inside the line of this short ball and hooked it out sight for a six long leg
Avesh Khan, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Two brilliant overs from Boult in terms of economy. RCB will be quietly happy they didn't allow Boult to go to his strength much - which is to target the stumps and pad with inswingers
Boult to Kohli, 1 run, Virat stays leg-side to go big but Boult cuts width and bowls this short of length delivery on the body, a pull straight to deep mid-wicket and just three off it
Boult to du Plessis, 1 run, short of length delivery, Faf wants to pull wide of mid-on but picks out the man

Boult to du Plessis, no run, the bumper to give the message to the batter that he's not just looking for full inswingers here. Faf sways out and it really flies to Sanju who had to jump slightly to collect
Boult to du Plessis, no run, Faf stepped out to kill swing and unsettle the bowler but Boult shaped this inswinger and also cramped the batter for room to thud the pad with ball going down leg
Boult to Kohli, 1 run, Virat wants a mighty piece of the ball again and goes with a lot of power on the pull, ball bounces from short of length and rolls to long leg off the splice of the bat
Boult to Kohli, no run, good length delivery angling away, Virat takes a forward stride and defends to the left of the bowler
Bit of a pressure releasing over that for RCb
Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, no run, defended to the off-side. No run, direct-hit at the striker's end and Faf is ready to steal an overthrow but Virat says no
Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, SIX, there's the first of the night. Sandeep goes searching for swing and bowls a slot ball, Faf says thank you very much and thumps it towards the sightscreen
Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, 1 run, oh he's swinging hard again! Inside edge dragged to deep mid-wicket as he slogged too hard
Sanju up to the stumps to stop Virat from advancing

Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, FOUR, and Virat gets the Ahmedabad crowd going. Runs at the bowler. They have long-on so he ensures he drags this wide past mid-wicket and this length delivery runs away to the boundary
Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, 1 run, oh inside edge past the stumps. Short of a length with width but the ball swung to trouble Faf on the cut, rolls behind square off the edge
Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, no run, slight inswing on this length delivery, Faf drives to mid-off
Sandeep Sharma, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack

Boult to Kohli, no run, oh wild swing and miss from Virat. Boult puts out a lone appeal for caught behind, he checks with his teammates again and they aren't convinced Virat hit this. Short of a length on seeing the batter advance, ball slips under the bat and goes to the keeper. Virat wanted to smash that over mid-wicket and UltraEdge stays flat
Boult to Kohli, no run, length and slightly moving in, Virat has the defence covered

Boult to du Plessis, leg byes, 1 run, ohh there's the Trent Boult killer inswinger. Lucky for Faf that the yorker was slightly down leg and he managed to get bat on ball despite falling. Boult has a smile on his face for the batter as the ball escapes to fine leg
Boult to du Plessis, no run, nip-backer but again the length is short and forces Faf on the back foot. Hits him high on the thigh as a surprised Faf tries to fend and gets hit on the thigh pad
Boult to du Plessis, no run, slightly fuller and slightly moving back into the right-hander but it's not quite the usual Trent Boult full yet. Faf covers the line and defends

Boult to Kohli, 1 run, straightaway Boult bowls into the wicket and didn't look for swing. Wonder if that wasn't deliberate. Short of a length just outside off stump, Virat softly nudges to backward square leg and opens his account
Kohli and du Plessis are at the crease. Kohli is on strike. Boult will open the attack
